courses.subject: EPID
courses.title: Basic Epidemiology and Health Statistics

meetings.instructor: Dr. WANG Jingxuan,   Professor KIM Jean Hee,   Professor KWOK Kin On,   Professor WANG Zixin,   Professor YANG Zuyao,   Professor YIP Hon Kei

Dr. WANG Jingxuan,   Miss CHIU Ka Man,   Ms. Prisana PAVIVAN,   Ms. YEUNG Tsz Yan,   Professor KIM Jean Hee,   Professor KWOK Kin On,   Professor WANG Zixin,   Professor YANG Zuyao,   Professor YIP Hon Kei

courses.description: This course serves as an introduction to epidemiology for students with health services or healthcare experience. The course gives a general overview of epidemiology and biostatistics, including theories and methodologies, and applications in health services management and other healthcare sectors. The course provides the basis for further studies.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Health Services Management and PgD Health Services Management

courses.subject: EPID
courses.title: Introduction to Epidemiology

meetings.instructor: Dr. WANG Jingxuan,   Professor KIM Jean Hee,   Professor KWOK Kin On,   Professor WANG Zixin,   Professor YANG Zuyao
Dr. WANG Jingxuan,   Miss CHIU Ka Man,   Ms. Prisana PAVIVAN,   Ms. YEUNG Tsz Yan,   Professor KIM Jean Hee,   Professor KWOK Kin On,   Professor WANG Zixin,   Professor YANG Zuyao

courses.description: This course will introduce basic epidemiology to students including introduction to epidemiology, applied health research methods, designing and conducting epidemiological studies (descriptive, case-control, cohort, clinical trials and meta-analysis).
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in Master of Public Health, PgD in Public Health, MSc in Epidemiology & Biostatistics or PgD in Epidemiology & Biostatistics

courses.subject: EPID
courses.title: Epidemiology II

meetings.instructor: Dr. WANG Jingxuan,   Professor KIM Jean Hee,   Professor TSOI Kam Fai,   Professor WANG Zixin,   Professor YANG Xue,   Professor YANG Zuyao

Dr. WANG Jingxuan,   Miss CHIU Ka Man,   Ms. Prisana PAVIVAN,   Ms. YEUNG Tsz Yan,   Professor KIM Jean Hee,   Professor TSOI Kam Fai,   Professor WANG Zixin,   Professor YANG Xue,   Professor YANG Zuyao

courses.description: This is an intermediate module which builds on the content of Introduction to Epidemiology (EPID5001). This module aims to provide students with further knowledge on cross sectional studies, cohort studies, randomized controlled trials, and systematic reviews.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in Master of Public Health, PgD in Epidemiology & Biostatistics or MSc in Epidemiology & Biostatistics

courses.subject: EPID
courses.title: Epidemiology III

meetings.instructor: Dr. WANG Jingxuan,   Professor KIM Jean Hee,   Professor LAM Yuen Tung,   Professor WANG Zixin,   Professor YANG Xue,   Professor YANG Zuyao

Dr. WANG Jingxuan,   Miss CHIU Ka Man,   Ms. Prisana PAVIVAN,   Ms. YEUNG Tsz Yan,   Professor KIM Jean Hee,   Professor LAM Yuen Tung,   Professor WANG Zixin,   Professor YANG Xue,   Professor YANG Zuyao

courses.description: Students shall learn how to conduct common statistical analyses of epidemiological data by using SPSS or other statistical software and to prepare scientific reports for publication. Sessions will consist of brief introduction of the concepts, computer demonstration and data analysis practicum. The session on reporting will be introduce international guidelines for drafting publications for systematic reviews and randomized trials.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in Master of Public Health, PgD in Epidemiology & Biostatistics or MSc in Epidemiology & Biostatistics

courses.subject: EPID
courses.title: Appraisal of the Methods of Epidemiological Studies

meetings.instructor: Dr. WANG Jingxuan,   Miss CHIU Ka Man,   Ms. Prisana PAVIVAN,   Ms. YEUNG Tsz Yan,   Professor CHAN Yan Chim,   Professor TSOI Kam Fai,   Professor WANG Zixin,   Professor WONG Tze Wai,   Professor YANG Zuyao

courses.description: The course will include a series of tutorials for appraising the methods of commonly used epidemiological study designs. In each tutorial, a published study of a specific design (e.g., randomized controlled trial) will be selected and presented and questions regarding the methods of the study will be asked. Students need to carefully read and discuss the questions beforehand and further discuss with the tutor and peers in the class.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc/PgD in Epidemiology and Biostatistics, MPhil in Public Health, PhD in Public Health, Master of Public Health, PgD in Public Health, MSc/PgD in Health Services Management, MSc/PgD in Health Promotion and Behavioural Health

courses.subject: EPID
courses.title: Selected Topics in Epidemiology

meetings.instructor: Dr. FENG Qi,   Professor CHUNG Ming Kei,   Professor KIM Jean Hee,   Professor KWOK Kin On,   Professor TSOI Kam Fai
Dr. FENG Qi,   Miss CHIU Ka Man,   Ms. Prisana PAVIVAN,   Ms. YEUNG Tsz Yan,   Professor CHUNG Ming Kei,   Professor KIM Jean Hee,   Professor KWOK Kin On,   Professor TSOI Kam Fai

courses.description: The course involves a series of guest lecture seminars in which methodological aspects of various areas of epidemiological research are discussed and elaborated.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in Master of Public Health and MSc in Epidemiology & Biostatistics

courses.subject: EPID
courses.title: Nutritional Epidemiology

meetings.instructor: Dr. LO Ka Hei Kenneth,   Miss CHIU Ka Man,   Ms. Prisana PAVIVAN,   Ms. YEUNG Tsz Yan

courses.description: In this course, you will learn about the methods used to assess dietary intakes and how to overcome limitations in assessing such a complex ‘exposure’. Nutrient intakes and dietary patterns in different population groups will be illustrated and key diet-disease associations will be presented. Finally, some of the challenges in interpreting nutritional epidemiology evidence and practical issues in communicating findings will be covered.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in Master of Public Health, MSc in Epidemiology & Biostatistics

courses.subject: EPID
courses.title: Practice in Systematic Review and Meta-analysis
courses.description: This course is an advanced module for students who are interested in conducting systematic review and meta-analysis. It emphasizes on practical knowledge and skills needed for doing this kind of research: performing exhaustive literature search to identify relevant studies, extracting data from eligible studies, assessing risk of bias, synthesizing data, including meta-analysis, presenting results graphically and tabularly, investigating heterogeneity and potential biases, and publishing manuscripts in peer-reviewed journals. Tutorial materials will be distributed to students for their in-class exercises. Students will be enabled to master the essential skills for doing systematic review and meta-analysis by the end of this module.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in Master of Public Health, MSc in Epidemiology & Biostatistics

courses.subject: EPID
courses.title: Digital Epidemiology

meetings.instructor: Miss CHIU Ka Man,   Ms. Prisana PAVIVAN,   Ms. YEUNG Tsz Yan,   Professor TSOI Kam Fai

courses.description: This advanced module introduces the concept of digital epidemiology with new forms of health data and real examples for disease management. The traditional epidemiology consists of studying various risk factors of the general population to study incidence and prevalence. The field of digital epidemiology is new, but has been growing rapidly with the increasing amounts of data generated on the internet, wearable devices, and mobile APPs. Students will explore the feasibility of applications through different real digital examples, including the consideration with data privacy and protection.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc in Epidemiology & Biostatistics, Master of Public Health Pre-requisite: EPID5001, BIOS5001

courses.subject: EPID
courses.title: Advanced Infectious Disease Epidemiology

meetings.instructor: Miss CHIU Ka Man,   Ms. Prisana PAVIVAN,   Ms. YEUNG Tsz Yan,   Professor KWOK Kin On

courses.description: This course is designed to enable post-graduate students who have a background in infectious diseases epidemiology to practice their skills in the real-life problem in infectious disease epidemiology. Contemporary statistical and mathematical methods will be introduced for the study of infectious disease epidemiological data. The course is illustrated with many topical examples including COVID-19, SARS, and influenza.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Epidemiology and Biostatistics and Master of Public Health Pre-requisite: EPID5001
